title: `trace_block` error: System.InvalidOperationException: Block without total difficulty calculated was suggested for processing
body:
**Description**

I use blockscout to index nethermind. But I get this error: `System.InvalidOperationException: Block without total difficulty calculated was suggested for processing`

**Logs**

```
2023-02-26 03:04:39.6768|INFO|201|Executing JSON RPC call parity_pendingTransactions with params []
2023-02-26 03:04:40.4640|INFO|129|Executing JSON RPC call trace_block with params [0xFB8354]
2023-02-26 03:04:40.4652|ERROR|129|Error during method execution, request: ID 0, trace_block(0xFB8354) System.InvalidOperationException: Block without total difficulty calculated was suggested for processing
   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.BlockchainProcessor.RunSimpleChecksAheadOfProcessing(Block suggestedBlock, ProcessingOptions options)
   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.BlockchainProcessor.Process(Block suggestedBlock, ProcessingOptions options, IBlockTracer tracer)
   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.OneTimeChainProcessor.Process(Block block, ProcessingOptions options, IBlockTracer tracer)
   at Nethermind.Consensus.Tracing.Tracer.Trace(Block block, IBlockTracer blockTracer)
   at Nethermind.JsonRpc.Modules.Trace.TraceRpcModule.TraceBlock(Block block, ParityLikeBlockTracer tracer)
   at Nethermind.JsonRpc.Modules.Trace.TraceRpcModule.trace_block(BlockParameter blockParameter)
   at InvokeStub_ITraceRpcModule.trace_block(Object, Object, IntPtr*)
   at System.Reflection.MethodInvoker.Invoke(Object obj, IntPtr* args, BindingFlags invokeAttr)
2023-02-26 03:04:40.4652|WARN|129|Error when handling ID 0, trace_block(0xFB8354) | {"jsonrpc":"2.0","error":{"code":-32603,"message":"Internal error","data":"System.InvalidOperationException: Block without total difficulty calculated was suggested for processing\n   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.BlockchainProcessor.RunSimpleChecksAheadOfProcessing(Block suggestedBlock, ProcessingOptions options)\n   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.BlockchainProcessor.Process(Block suggestedBlock, ProcessingOptions options, IBlockTracer tracer)\n   at Nethermind.Consensus.Processing.OneTimeChainProcessor.Process(Block block, ProcessingOptions options, IBlockTracer tracer)\n   at Nethermind.Consensus.Tracing.Tracer.Trace(Block block, IBlockTracer blockTracer)\n   at Nethermind.JsonRpc.Modules.Trace.TraceRpcModule.TraceBlock(Block block, ParityLikeBlockTracer tracer)\n   at Nethermind.JsonRpc.Modules.Trace.TraceRpcModule.trace_block(BlockParameter blockParameter)\n   at InvokeStub_ITraceRpcModule.trace_block(Object, Object, IntPtr*)\n   at System.Reflection.MethodInvoker.Invoke(Object obj, IntPtr* args, BindingFlags invokeAttr)"},"id":0}
```
Any update ? Is this the same issue as https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/5238 ?
@abcfy2 I tried to reproduce this issue, but no luck. As I understand it only happens with block 16483156 on mainnet?

> @abcfy2 I tried to reproduce this issue, but no luck. As I understand it only happens with block 16483156 on mainnet?

Yeah. Seems only block number `16483156` on mainnet has this issue. How to resolve ?

> @abcfy2 I tried to reproduce this issue, but no luck. As I understand it only happens with block 16483156 on mainnet?

Any update ? Thanks.
@abcfy2 All works fine on our node. Can you share the logs? Probably you have some problem with db. You can resync the node if it's feasible

> @abcfy2 All works fine on our node. Can you share the logs? Probably you have some problem with db. You can resync the node if it's feasible

Thanks. Here is my logs:


Do you need more logs ? Please let me know.

And how to resync the node ? Is there any way to force resync only one or a few blocks ? I don't want to delete all the data and sync again. Because it's 14 TB which will sync too much time.

@abcfy2 
Can you execute these requests? Transactions are not needed
`curl <IP>:<port> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["0xFB8354"],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}'`
`curl <IP>:<port> -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"method":"eth_getBlockByNumber","params":["latest"],"id":1,"jsonrpc":"2.0"}'`
@abcfy2 Thanks, I'm 99% sure that td for that block for some reason is missing from your db. We will think about how we can fix this issue without resyncing the node

> @abcfy2 Thanks, I'm 99% sure that td for that block for some reason is missing from your db. We will think about how we can fix this issue without resyncing the node

Many thanks. Waiting for your feedback.
